Description: Silver finger-ring; stirrup-shaped with a rounded band; Egyptian or Egyptianising; convex oval bezel incised with Bes with a tail and wearing a feathered crown, near his right hand is a curved object, perhaps a snake or sceptre.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (998)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 51)
